chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Your Response:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

Your Response:
```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
None

Goal:
forall a b : Z, b <> OZ -> diveuclZ a b

Premises:
Inductive diveuclZ (a b : Z) : Set := divexZ : forall q r : Z, is_diveuclZ a b q r -> diveuclZ a b
Inductive Z : Set := OZ : Z | pos : nat -> Z | neg : nat -> Z Arguments pos _%nat_scope Arguments neg _%nat_scope
divexZ : forall a b q r : Z, is_diveuclZ a b q r -> diveuclZ a b
diveuclZ_ind : forall (a b : Z) (P : diveuclZ a b -> Prop), (forall (q r : Z) (i : is_diveuclZ a b q r), P (divexZ a b q r i)) -> forall d : diveuclZ a b, P d
diveuclZ_rec : forall (a b : Z) (P : diveuclZ a b -> Set), (forall (q r : Z) (i : is_diveuclZ a b q r), P (divexZ a b q r i)) -> forall d : diveuclZ a b, P d
diveuclZ_sind : forall (a b : Z) (P : diveuclZ a b -> SProp), (forall (q r : Z) (i : is_diveuclZ a b q r), P (divexZ a b q r i)) -> forall d : diveuclZ a b, P d
diveuclZ_rect : forall (a b : Z) (P : diveuclZ a b -> Type), (forall (q r : Z) (i : is_diveuclZ a b q r), P (divexZ a b q r i)) -> forall d : diveuclZ a b, P d
BinInt.Z.rem_divide : forall a b : BinNums.Z, b <> BinNums.Z0 -> BinInt.Z.rem a b = BinNums.Z0 < -> BinInt.Z.divide b a
BinInt.Z.rem_eq : forall a b : BinNums.Z, b <> BinNums.Z0 -> BinInt.Z.rem a b = BinInt.Z.sub a (BinInt.Z.mul b (BinInt.Z.quot a b))
BinInt.Z.quot_mul_cancel_r : forall a b c : BinNums.Z, b <> BinNums.Z0 -> c <> BinNums.Z0 -> BinInt.Z.quot (BinInt.Z.mul a c) (BinInt.Z.mul b c) = BinInt.Z.quot a b
BinInt.Z.div_mul_cancel_r : forall a b c : BinNums.Z, b <> BinNums.Z0 -> c <> BinNums.Z0 -> BinInt.Z.div (BinInt.Z.mul a c) (BinInt.Z.mul b c) = BinInt.Z.div a b
BinInt.Z.quot_mul : forall a b : BinNums.Z, b <> BinNums.Z0 -> BinInt.Z.quot (BinInt.Z.mul a b) b = a
Nat.pow_le_mono_r : forall a b c : nat, a <> 0 -> b <= c -> a ^ b <= a ^ c
BinInt.Z.rem_opp_r : forall a b : BinNums.Z, b <> BinNums.Z0 -> BinInt.Z.rem a (BinInt.Z.opp b) = BinInt.Z.rem a b
BinInt.Z.quot_rem : forall a b : BinNums.Z, b <> BinNums.Z0 -> a = BinInt.Z.add (BinInt.Z.mul b (BinInt.Z.quot a b)) (BinInt.Z.rem a b)
BinInt.Z.div_mod : forall a b : BinNums.Z, b <> BinNums.Z0 -> a = BinInt.Z.add (BinInt.Z.mul b (BinInt.Z.div a b)) (BinInt.Z.modulo a b)
Nat.pow_lt_mono_l : forall a b c : nat, c <> 0 -> a < b -> a ^ c < b ^ c
BinInt.Z.rem_mul : forall a b : BinNums.Z, b <> BinNums.Z0 -> BinInt.Z.rem (BinInt.Z.mul a b) b = BinNums.Z0
BinInt.Z.rem_nonneg : forall a b : BinNums.Z, b <> BinNums.Z0 -> BinInt.Z.le BinNums.Z0 a -> BinInt.Z.le BinNums.Z0 (BinInt.Z.rem a b)
BinInt.Z.div_opp_opp : forall a b : BinNums.Z, b <> BinNums.Z0 -> BinInt.Z.div (BinInt.Z.opp a) (BinInt.Z.opp b) = BinInt.Z.div a b
BinInt.Z.quot_opp_opp : forall a b : BinNums.Z, b <> BinNums.Z0 -> BinInt.Z.quot (BinInt.Z.opp a) (BinInt.Z.opp b) = BinInt.Z.quot a b
BinInt.Z.quot_opp_l : forall a b : BinNums.Z, b <> BinNums.Z0 -> BinInt.Z.quot (BinInt.Z.opp a) b = BinInt.Z.opp (BinInt.Z.quot a b)
BinNat.N.pow_lt_mono_l_iff : forall a b c : BinNums.N, c <> BinNums.N0 -> BinNat.N.lt a b < -> BinNat.N.lt (BinNat.N.pow a c) (BinNat.N.pow b c)
Zdiv.Zdiv_mult_cancel_r : forall a b c : BinNums.Z, c <> BinNums.Z0 -> BinInt.Z.div (BinInt.Z.mul a c) (BinInt.Z.mul b c) = BinInt.Z.div a b
Nat.pow_lt_mono_l_iff : forall a b c : nat, c <> 0 -> a < b < -> a ^ c < b ^ c
BinInt.Z.quot_opp_r : forall a b : BinNums.Z, b <> BinNums.Z0 -> BinInt.Z.quot a (BinInt.Z.opp b) = BinInt.Z.opp (BinInt.Z.quot a b)
Nat.even_pow : forall a b : nat, b <> 0 -> Nat.even (a ^ b) = Nat.even a
Nat.odd_pow : forall a b : nat, b <> 0 -> Nat.odd (a ^ b) = Nat.odd a
BinInt.Z.log2_up_add_le : forall a b : BinNums.Z, a <> BinNums.Zpos BinNums.xH -> b <> BinNums.Zpos BinNums.xH -> BinInt.Z.le (BinInt.Z.log2_up (BinInt.Z.add a b)) (BinInt.Z.add (BinInt.Z.log2_up a) (BinInt.Z.log2_up b))
BinInt.Z.quot_abs_r : forall a b : BinNums.Z, b <> BinNums.Z0 -> BinInt.Z.quot a (BinInt.Z.abs b) = BinInt.Z.mul (BinInt.Z.sgn b) (BinInt.Z.quot a b)
is_diveuclZ = fun a b q r : Z => b <> OZ /\ leZ OZ r /\ ltZ r (absZ b) /\ a = addZ (multZ b q) r : Z -> Z -> Z -> Z -> Prop
BinInt.Z.rem_bound_pos : forall a b : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.le BinNums.Z0 a -> BinInt.Z.lt BinNums.Z0 b -> BinInt.Z.le BinNums.Z0 (BinInt.Z.rem a b) /\ BinInt.Z.lt (BinInt.Z.rem a b) b

```coq
Theorem diveuclZ: forall a b : Z, b <> OZ -> diveuclZ a b.
Proof.
  intros a b Hb.
  apply diveuclZ_ind with (P := fun q r => diveuclZ a b).
  - intros q r i.
    destruct i as [Hb' [Hr [Hlr [Hlr' Ha]]]].
    exists q, r.
    split; eauto.
  - intros d.
    inversion d; subst.
    inversion H; subst.
    exists x, y.
    repeat split; eauto.
Qed.```
